may from time to time be requested, in writing, from the Kane County
development department.
Grantee shall provide to the Kane County development department two (2) copies
of any report required by this section. Should the grantee seek to maintain
confidentiality of the aforementioned reports under the Illinois freedom of
information act, the grantee shall follow the process set forth in subsection
10.5-135D of this chapter. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-137: FILING OF RULES AND REGULATIONS:
The grantee shall from time to time, as promulgated, file with the Kane County
development department copies of all current rules, policies, terms, and
conditions established or imposed by the grantee in connection with the
establishment, construction, operation, and maintenance of the CATV system.
(Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-138 - 10.5-139: RESERVED:
DIVISION 12. SYSTEM STANDARDS
10.5-140: FCC TECHNICAL STANDARDS:
   A.   The grantee shall construct and operate the cable system to comply with
the FCC technical standards contained in part 76, subpart K of the commission's
rules and regulations, as updated and amended from time to time (47 CFR part
76, subpart K).
   B.   The grantee shall perform all tests necessary to determine compliance
with the FCC technical standards. Tests shall include, at minimum, proof of
performance tests required by FCC rule section 76.601 (47 CFR part 76.601) and
such additional or repeat tests involving specified subscriber terminals as may
be required to determine compliance with the FCC technical standards. Within
fifteen (15) days following a written request, the county shall have the right
to review the testing records required to be maintained by the grantee pursuant
to the FCC's rules.
   C.   Where there exists recurring evidence, which in the judgment of the
county, casts doubt upon the reliability or quality of cable service, the
county shall have the right and authority to require the grantee to test,
analyze, and report on the performance of the cable system. The grantee shall
fully cooperate with the county in performing such testing and shall prepare
results, and a report, if requested, within thirty (30) days after notice. Such
report shall include the following information:
      1.   The nature of the complaint or problem that precipitated the special
tests;
      2.   The system component(s) tested;
      3.   The equipment used and procedures employed in testing;
      4.   The method, if any, in which such complaint or problem is resolved;
and
      5.   Any other information pertinent to the tests and analyses, which may
be required.
   D.   The county may require that an independent experienced professional
observe tests. A person shall be deemed an independent experienced professional
if he or she is not an employee of the county and has participated in similar
tests for other local franchising authorities or cable operators in the state
of Illinois. The professional shall be given records of any required tests and
shall forward to the county and grantee such records with a report interpreting
the results of the tests. The grantee shall conform to the FCC proof of
performance standards (47 USC section 76 subpart K). In the event that the
county should require that tests conducted by the grantee be supervised or
readministered, the county shall be responsible for the costs of an independent
experienced professional. In the event that the results of the test show that
the grantee is at fault, or that the grantee's tests were not conducted in
accordance with FCC technical standards, the grantee shall be responsible for
assuming the costs of the professional and the tests performed.
   E.   The county may, at a minimum, require tests, analyses, and reports
covering specific subjects and characteristics based on complaints concerning
CATV system performance tendered by the public, or other evidence when and
under such circumstances, the county has reasonable grounds to believe that
complaints or other evidence require that tests be performed in order to assure
that the CATV system is operating in compliance with FCC technical standards.
   F.   Not later than ninety (90) days after any new or substantially rebuilt
portion of a CATV system is made available for service to subscribers,
technical performance tests shall be conducted by the grantee to demonstrate
full compliance with FCC technical standards.
Such tests shall be performed by, or under the supervision of an engineer with
proper training and experience. A copy of the report shall be submitted to the
cable administrator describing test results, instrumentation, calibration, and
test procedure, and the qualifications of the engineer responsible for the
tests. In the event that the semiannual FCC proof of performance testing of the
CATV system occurs during the aforementioned ninety (90) day period, the proof
of performance test results from the new or substantially rebuilt portion of
the CATV system shall meet the requirements of this subsection. At the option
of the county, reasonable additional tests may be required, at the expense of
the grantee, if the grantee is unable to meet FCC technical standards based
upon the results of technical performance tests or proof of performance tests.
Any additional tests shall be conducted under the supervision of an engineer
with proper training and experience.
   G.   RF leakage shall be checked at locations for emergency radio services
in the longest feeder line or at trunk line extremities, not less than twice
per month, so as to prove no interference signal combinations are possible.
Radiation shall be measured adjacent to any proposed aeronautical navigation or
communication radio sites to prove that no interference to air navigational
reception is possible. Upon request, reports of grantee's cumulative leakage
index (CLI) performance data shall be filed with the Kane County development
department.
   H.   At any time after commencement of service of subscribers, the county
may require additional reasonable tests, including full or partial repeat tests
complying with the procedures of 47 CFR section 76, subpart K, involving a
subscriber's terminal, at the grantee's expense to the extent that such tests
may be performed by the grantee's employees using existing facilities and
equipment; provided, however, that the county reserves the right to conduct its
own tests upon reasonable notice to a grantee and if noncompliance is found,
the expense thereof shall be borne by the grantee. The county shall endeavor to
arrange its request for such special tests so as to minimize hardship or
inconvenience to the grantee or to the subscriber.
   I.   If the FCC should delete the requirements of 47 CFR section 76, subpart
K, the county hereby reserves the right to amend this article and any franchise
agreement to incorporate similar standards, and every franchise granted
pursuant to this article shall be subject to such reserved power whether or not
expressly so conditioned.
   J.   Pursuant to 220 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/21-1001(a), the foregoing
conditions of subsections A through I of this section shall apply to a holder
of a state issued authorization to provide video service in the unincorporated
areas of the county. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-141: OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
The grantee shall at all times during the term of the agreement comply with the
following:
   A.   National electrical safety code of the Institute Of Electrical And
Electronic Engineers (IEEE) (latest edition).
   B.   National electrical code of the National Fire Protection Association
(latest edition).
   C.   Underwriters Laboratories (UL) code (latest edition).
   D.   Any electrical code adopted and provided to the grantee by the county
that may include standards at variance with the codes referenced in subsections
A, B, and C of this section.
   E.   Tower standards:
      1.   EIA-RS-222A.
      2.   Federal aviation administration ("FAA") tower lighting standards.
   F.   The county reserves the right to review a grantee's construction plans
prior to the commencement of construction. The county shall not, however, be
required to make inspections or approve the grantee's system and plans, and
specifically disclaims such obligation. A grantee shall be solely responsible
for taking all steps necessary to assure compliance with such laws and
regulations and the safety of its system as installed.
   G.   A grantee shall design, construct, operate and maintain the CATV system
so that signals carried are delivered to subscribers without material
degradation in quality.
   H.   In no event shall the CATV system endanger or interfere with the safety
of persons or property within the county. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-
2008)
10.5-142: LINE EXTENSION:
   A.   Whenever the density of dwelling units in newly established
subdivisions of the county equals or exceeds twenty (20) dwelling units per
cable route mile, service will be provided at the same rates as other areas of
the county, within three (3) months, weather permitting, provided that grantee
will not be required to service a new subdivision until twenty five percent
(25%) of the homes in such subdivision, or in any platted unit of the
subdivision have been built.
   B.   A grantee shall extend and make service available to any potential
subscriber within the limits of the franchise area of the county in accordance
with the timetable and geographic specifications as designed in a franchise
agreement.
   C.   A grantee shall extend and make cable service available to any resident
not meeting the standard of this section, and requesting connection at the
standard connection charge, if the connection to the resident would require no
more than a standard one hundred twenty five foot (125') drop line.
   D.   The grantee may elect to provide service to areas not meeting the above
density and distance standards. The grantee may impose an additional reasonable
charge in excess of its regular installation charge for any service
installation requiring a drop or line extension in excess of the above
standards.
   E.   Grantee will make every effort to offer services to the commercial
establishments within the franchise area, provided that the installation is
economically reasonable. The commercial establishment shall be responsible for
the total cost of installation as determined by the grantee.
   F.   Upon deannexation by a municipality located within the county of any
territory contiguous to unincorporated Kane County and upon assumption of
control of such territory by the county where no cable service exists, the
grantee shall, at the request of the county in this agreement, provide service
to said areas where there exists an average of twenty (20) occupied residential
dwelling units per cable mile, whether located in single- or multi-family
buildings. In the event that a municipality annexes territory of unincorporated
Kane County, the county shall retain franchise fees and video service provider
fees from subscribers located in that territory for a period of time as
prescribed by 55 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/5-1095(a). (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-
2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-143: GENERAL CONSTRUCTION STANDARDS:
   A.   Construction, installation, and maintenance of a CATV system or a
system constructed under a state issued authorization to provide video service
shall be performed in an orderly and workmanlike manner, and in close
coordination with public and private utilities serving the county following
accepted construction practices and procedures.
   B.   All cables and wires shall be installed where possible, parallel with
electric and telephone lines, and multiple cable configurations shall be
arranged in parallel and bundled together with proper lashing or conduit with
due respect for engineering and safety considerations.
   C.   A grantee shall identify its CATV system, and a holder shall identify
its video service system and drops by either color coding, stamping, engraving,
or tagging so as to distinguish its cables from those of other utilities and
telecommunications providers serving the franchise area or the area within the
unincorporated areas of the county authorized by the ICC to be served by a
holder.
   D.   All contractors and subcontractors of a grantee or a holder must be
properly licensed under all applicable federal, state and local laws and
regulations. The grantee or holder shall be solely and completely responsible
for all acts or omissions of any and all of the grantee's or holder's
contractors or subcontractors in the construction, installation, maintenance or
operation of the grantee's cable system, or the holder's video service system.
   E.   A grantee or a holder shall follow the procedures set forth from time
to time by the Kane County division of transportation permit regulations and
access control regulations for the siting and construction of any CATV system
or video service system structure on county property.
   F.   A grantee shall provide a construction schedule, timetable, and plans
calculated and drawn upon the best of its estimation to the cable administrator
prior to rebuilding, reconstruction, or upgrading of the CATV system or the
video service system. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-144: ANTENNA STRUCTURES:
Any antenna structure used in the CATV system or video service system shall
comply with construction, marking, and lighting of antenna structures required
by the U.S. department of transportation or the federal aviation
administration. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-145: AERIAL SYSTEM PLANT:
   A.   Aerial cable shall be located at the height minimums established by the
national electrical code (IEEE, 2005 edition), currently fifteen and one-half
feet (15'6") over a public roadway or driveway, and ten feet (10'0") over a
pedestrian area, such as a sidewalk, bicycle path, or trail.
   B.   Construction and placement of an aerial subscriber drop or service line
drop connected to a dwelling unit shall be at the direction of the subscriber
or the county. Grantee or holder shall be responsible for securing the written
authorization for the method employed and shall keep said authorization on file
until the expiration of its franchise agreement or state issued authorization.
   C.   A subscriber shall have the option to have the grantee or holder
connect a standard drop to the dwelling unit by either:
      1.   Connection of the aerial drop to the dwelling unit at a minimum of
twelve feet (12') above the ground level; or
      2.   Attachment of the drop to the side of the utility pole and buried
from the base of the utility pole to the dwelling unit at a depth of no less
than six inches (6"). (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-146: UNDERGROUND PLANT:
   A.   In all sections of the franchise area or the unincorporated areas of
the county authorized to be served by a holder where the cables, wires, or
other like facilities are placed underground, the grantee or holder shall place
its cables, wires, or other like facilities underground to the maximum extent
that existing technology reasonably permits the grantee or holder to do so.
Utility facilities mounted aboveground, including, but not limited to,
pedestals, power supply boxes, copper fiber cross circuit boxes, nodes, and
amplifier boxes may be placed aboveground if existing technology reasonably
requires them to be placed aboveground. With regard to any aboveground utility
facility located in a county right of way, a grantee or holder shall comply
with the requirements of the Kane County division of transportation permit
regulations and access control regulations. With regard to any aboveground
utility facility located on private property, a grantee or holder shall comply
with the requirements of the Kane County zoning ordinance.
   B.   Burial standards shall be as follows:
      1.   Longitudinal lines within a county right of way shall be buried in
accordance with the Kane County division of transportation permit regulations
and access control regulations.
Trunk lines buried on private property shall be buried no less than forty two
inches (42") deep.
      2.   All underground feeder cable plant on private property shall be
buried no less than twelve inches (12") nor more than eighteen inches (18")
deep.
      3.   All underground drops on private property shall be buried six inches
(6") to twelve inches (12") deep.
      4.   All underground plant located under driveways shall be buried thirty
six inches (36") below the surface of the driveway.
   C.   To the extent possible, amplifier boxes, mounted pedestals, node boxes,
fiber copper cross circuit boxes, copper circuit boxes, and power supply boxes
shall be located not more than four feet (4') from the aboveground facilities
of any other existing utility located in an easement or right of way.
   D.   In areas of new construction or property development where utilities
are to be placed underground, the county shall require the developer or
property owner to give the grantee or holder reasonable notice of such
construction or development, and of the particular date on which open trenching
will be available for the grantee's or holder's installation of conduit,
pedestals, and/or vaults and laterals to be provided at the grantee's expense
or holder's expense. The grantee or holder shall provide specifications as
needed for trenching. Costs of trenching and easements required to bring
service to the development shall be borne by the developer or property owner;
except that if the grantee or holder fails to install its conduit, pedestals
and/or vaults and laterals within ten (10) working days of the date the
trenches are available, as designated in the notice given by the property owner
or developer to the grantee or holder, then the cost shall be borne by the
grantee or holder if the trenches are closed after the ten (10) day period.
   E.   A grantee or holder shall remove, at its sole cost and expense, any
underground cable or conduit by trenching or opening of the rights of way along
the extension thereof or which is otherwise ordered to be removed by the Kane
County department of transportation based upon a determination, in the
discretion of the county engineer, that removal is required in order to
eliminate or prevent a hazardous condition or promote future utilization of the
rights of way for public purposes. The schedule and timing of removal shall be
subject to approval and regulation by the county engineer.
   F.   With respect to any cables, wires and other like facilities constructed
and installed by a grantee or holder aboveground, the grantee or holder shall,
at its sole expense, reconstruct and reinstall such cables, wires or other
facilities underground pursuant to any project under which the cables, wires or
other like facilities of all like utilities are placed underground within an
area. Tap and feeder connections installed underground shall be protected by a
weather resistant cover that is mounted flush with the surrounding ground or
pavement.
   G.   At the request of any property owner, a grantee or holder shall place
the particular CATV system or video service system facilities underground,
provided that all reasonable costs exceeding aboveground installation shall be
borne by the property owner making the request.
   H.   All underground work required by the county in concert with other
utilities shall be done in a coordinated fashion. Grantee or holder shall
participate in any joint conferences for each project to bring all utilities
including grantee's or holder's plant, from an aerial to an underground status.
   I.   Grantee or holder shall share both map prints and locating information
to help minimize any disturbance to either grantee's, holder's and/or another
entity's underground distribution network. A grantee or holder shall be
responsible for contacting joint utility locating information for excavators
(JULIE) for all of its construction and for responding in a timely manner to
requests from JULIE to locate its cables. Neither the county nor residents
shall be liable for damage to grantee's or holder's unmarked or erroneously
marked plant. All work shall be done in accordance with the JULIE
specifications and a record of all locate and dig requests shall be maintained
by grantee at its principal offices. All underground construction shall be done
by directional boring, except where safety or other conditions preclude it or
render it unnecessary. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-147: STANDBY POWER:
Each CATV system or video service system shall include the equipment capable of
providing standby and backup powering. Standby power equipment shall provide
standby powering for a minimum of three (3) hours for transportation and trunk
amplifiers, and forty eight (48) hours at the headend. The system shall
incorporate safeguards necessary to prevent injury to linemen resulting from a
standby generator powering a "dead" utility line. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff.
9-1-2008)
10.5-148: INTERFERENCE WITH NONSUBSCRIBERS:
A grantee's CATV system or a holder's video service system shall be operated in
such a manner as to avoid causing interference with reception of over the air
signals by nonsubscribers. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-149: TWENTY FOUR HOUR OPERATION:
Any CATV system or video service system shall be designed, constructed,
operated, and maintained for twenty four (24) hours a day continuous operation,
except during those times where all or part of the system is subjected to
repair, maintenance, construction or reconstruction. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008,
eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-150: WORK FORCE:
A grantee or a holder shall employ a work force capable of providing
maintenance and repair of the CATV system or video service system having proper
vehicles and equipment necessary to adequately maintain and operate the CATV
system or video service system. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-151: STATUS MONITORING:
Each CATV system or video service system shall have the capacity to identify
system faults through electronic status monitoring equipment installed at
locations consistent with a grantee's or holder's engineering practices. (Ord.
08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-152: SIGNAL INTERRUPTIONS AND ROUTINE MAINTENANCE:
A grantee or holder shall not interrupt all or any part of the services of its
system in the absence of absolute need or emergency circumstances, except for
routine maintenance of the system. Routine maintenance involving the use of
power generation equipment, such as gas powered generators, shall be conducted
during the daylight hours. Routine maintenance in subscriber easements by a
grantee, a holder or its subcontractors is limited to daylight hours. (Ord. 08-
252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-153 - 10.5-159:   RESERVED:
DIVISION 13. LOCATION OF STRUCTURES, USE OF RIGHTS OF WAY AND POLE ATTACHMENTS
10.5-160: LOCATION OF STRUCTURES:
All transmission and distribution structures, line and equipment erected by a
grantee within the franchise area shall be so located as to cause minimum
interference with the proper use of rights of way and other public ways and
places, and to cause minimum interference with the rights and reasonable
convenience of property owners who adjoin county rights of way. (Ord. 08-252,
8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-161: RESTORATION AND REPLACEMENT:
In case of any disturbance of any portion of a county right of way, a grantee
shall follow the procedures of the utility permit policy as set forth in the
Kane County division of transportation permit regulations and access control
regulations. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-162: RELOCATION OF STRUCTURES:
If at any time during the period of a franchise, the Kane County division of
transportation, any township highway department, or the Illinois department of
transportation shall lawfully elect to alter or change the grade of any right
of way, a grantee shall follow the procedures of the utility permit policy as
set forth in the Kane County division of transportation permit regulations and
access control regulations. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-163: COMPLIANCE WITH HIGHWAY AUTHORITY:
Any poles or other fixtures placed in a county right of way shall be placed in
such manner as to comply with Kane County development department regulations
and Kane County division of transportation permit regulations and access
control regulations, or the standards and regulations of any other lawful
highway authority. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-164: TEMPORARY REMOVAL:
A grantee shall, at the request of any person holding a building moving permit
issued by the county, temporarily raise or lower its wires to permit the moving
of buildings. The expense of such temporary removal or raising or lowering of
wires shall be paid by the person requesting the same, and the grantee shall
have the authority to require such payment in advance. The grantee shall be
given not less than seventy two (72) hours' advance notice to arrange for such
temporary wire changes. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-165: AUTHORITY TO MAINTAIN TREES AND VEGETATION:
A grantee shall obtain permission from the Kane County division of
transportation to trim or cut trees upon and overhanging county rights of way.
Where such right of way is located in a historic district or on a thoroughfare
designated by the county as a "rustic road", permission from the development
department shall be required. At the option of the county, tree trimming or
cutting may be done by the county or under county supervision and direction at
a grantee's expense. In any case, a grantee shall make every effort to preserve
shrubs and trees and shall be responsible for and indemnify, defend, and hold
harmless the county and its officers, agents, and employees from and against
any and all damages arising out of or resulting from the removal, trimming,
mutilation, or injury to any trees or shrubs proximately caused by the grantee,
or its officers, agents, employees, contractors, or subcontractors. A grantee
shall follow the requirements set forth for tree cutting in the Kane County
division of transportation permit regulations and access control regulations.
(Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-166: OBLIGATION TO AVOID DAMAGING PERSONAL PROPERTY:
A grantee shall make every effort to avoid damaging underground structures or
systems on any county right of way, public easement, or private easement during
construction, maintenance, repair, or removal of a CATV system. A grantee shall
indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the county and its officers, agents, and
employees from any and all damages arising out of or resulting from any of the
grantee's activities which damage or interfere with underground structures or
systems. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-167: POLES AND POLE ATTACHMENTS:
   A.   No poles or other wire holding structures that are to be located in a
right of way owned by the county shall be erected without approval of the Kane
County division of transportation and shall be erected in accordance with the
division's permit regulations and access control regulations.
Removal of poles from a county right of way shall be at the expense of a
grantee in the event that the division of transportation determines that
removal of the pole is necessary for reasons of public safety or convenience.
   B.   The division of transportation shall have the right to require a
grantee to locate aerial plant on poles or other wire holding structures
currently in existence and where such poles serve the county if the division of
transportation finds that use by a grantee of such poles would be necessary for
reasons of public safety or convenience, and the terms for use of the poles or
other wire holding structures are just and reasonable in accordance with
applicable federal and state law.
   C.   Poles owned by a grantee shall not infringe on any other properly
existing use within a county right of way.
   D.   The county will not be responsible or have any duty to obtain consent,
licenses, permission or easements where the county has no jurisdiction or
authority to grant such consent, licenses, permissions or easements. (Ord. 08-
252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-168: CATV SYSTEM RELOCATION:
   A.   The grantee shall remove, at its sole cost and expense, any underground
cable or conduit by trenching or opening of the rights of way along the
extension thereof or which is otherwise ordered to be removed by the county
engineer based upon a determination, at the discretion of the county engineer
that removal is required in order to eliminate or prevent a hazardous condition
or promote further utilization of the rights of way for public purposes.
   B.   If the grades or lines of any county right of way are lawfully changed
at any time during a franchise agreement term, then a grantee shall, upon
reasonable advance written notice from the county, protect or promptly alter or
relocate the CATV system, or any part thereof, at the grantee's expense, so as
to conform with any such new grades or lines. In the event utilities using a
public right of way are required to relocate and compensation is paid by the
county to the users of such public right of way, all grantees shall be treated
equally with respect to such compensation. At such time that a grantee must
relocate its CATV system plant due to road or highway improvement, it shall
relocate its plant in accordance with timetables established by the county and
shall relocate its lines in a manner as to avoid interference with road
improvements and other utilities at no cost to the county. Relocations may be
subject to the provisions of 605 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/9-113. (Ord. 08-
252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-169: APPROVAL OF CONSTRUCTION:
   A.   A grantee shall not, within the franchise area, run any line, make any
attachment, nor shall any construction of any kind be commenced without the
necessary permits and the prior approval of the Kane County division of
transportation and the county engineer.
   B.   Action on requests for permits shall be taken on any request for
approval of a permit in accordance with the time frames and procedures
established by the Kane County division of transportation permit manual. A
grantee shall be able to make emergency repairs as needed. The county shall
have and maintain the right to inspect the construction, operation, and
maintenance of the CATV system by a grantee to ensure the proper installation
thereof under the terms of this article. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-
2008)
10.5-170: SECURITY BOND:
   A.   Unless otherwise agreed to in a franchise agreement, upon grant of a
franchise the grantee shall file and shall maintain at all times thereafter in
full force and effect, an acceptable surety bond issued by a surety licensed to
do business in the state of Illinois, in the amount of five hundred thousand
dollars ($500,000.00) during periods of construction or major reconstruction
and one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) at all other times.
   B.   The bond may be drawn upon by the county or the surety bond called upon
after affording the grantee due process, as outlined in section 10.5-123 of
this chapter, with respect to alleged violations, for purposes including, but
not limited to, the following:
      1.   Failure of a grantee to pay the county undisputed sums due under the
terms of the agreement;
      2.   Reimbursement of costs borne by the county to correct violations of
this chapter or a franchise agreement not corrected by the grantee;
      3.   Monetary remedies of undisputed damages assessed against a grantee
due to default or breach of requirements of this chapter or a franchise
agreement;
      4.   Failure to relocate or remove CATV system plant or appurtenances in
accordance with the terms and conditions of this chapter, or a franchise
agreement, or failure to reimburse the county for such removal.
   C.   If the grantee fails within fifteen (15) days after the notice of
failure to pay on the due date, to pay the Kane County treasurer any franchise
fees, assessment, or taxes lawfully due that the county determines can be
remedied by a call upon the surety bond, the county may thereafter call upon
the surety for payment under the bond. Upon such withdrawal, the county shall
notify the grantee of the amount and date thereof, as estimated by the county
based upon prior payments by the surety.
   D.   If, during the term of the agreement, the grantee fails to renew the
surety bond, the county may, after providing grantee thirty (30) days' notice
of intent to do so, call upon the surety not more than five (5) days before
such expiration date.
   E.   The county shall give the grantee written notice of any payment from
the surety under this section, specifying the amount and the specific reason
for such payment. Within thirty (30) days following receipt by the grantee of
written notice from the county that any amount has been paid out by the surety,
the grantee shall restore such surety bond to the amount required under the
agreement. Failure by the grantee to restore the surety bond shall be
considered a material violation of this chapter.
   F.   The rights reserved by the county with respect to the surety bond are
in addition to all other rights of the county whether reserved by this chapter
or authorized by law or equity, and no action, proceeding, or exercise of a
right with respect to surety bond shall constitute a waiver of any other right
the county may have. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-171 - 10.5-179:   RESERVED:
DIVISION 14. SERVICES TO COUNTY FACILITIES; ACCESS PROGRAMMING
10.5-180: SERVICE TO COUNTY BUILDINGS:
A grantee and a holder shall provide service to county buildings pursuant to
the requirements of section
10.5-80 of this chapter, which are also found in 220 Illinois Compiled Statutes
5/22-501(f)(1-2). (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-181: GOVERNMENT ACCESS CHANNEL:
   A.   Upon request of the county, each grantee or holder shall provide
channel capacity for access programming on the most basic cable or video
service tier offered by grantee or holder in accordance with section 611 of the
cable act (47 USC section 531), and the cable and video competition act of 2007
1 , or on a mutually agreed upon tier of service. The grantee shall designate
one channel on its CATV system and a holder shall designate one channel for the
use of the county for the purpose of providing government access programming.
This channel shall be made available to unincorporated as well as incorporated
county residents. In the event that the county ceases programming on the
government access channel in its entirety, the county shall recognize the
grantee's or the holder's desire to place commercial programming on the
channel, and shall, at the written request of the grantee or the holder,
relinquish the use of the channel to the grantee or the holder in accordance
with section 612 of the cable act (47 USC section 532(b)(4)) within sixty (60)
calendar days of the receipt of such notice by the county.
   B.   In the event that grantee or the holder is required to relocate the
numeric position of an access channel or channels, the grantee shall give the
county advance reasonable notice with regard to the timing and logistics of the
relocation. A grantee or holder and the cable administrator shall meet to
determine the best and most practicable methods of notifying customers of the
pending channel relocation. Changing of an access channel numeric location
shall not occur without the approval of the county. The grantee or holder shall
not exercise editorial control over any governmental use of channel capacity
and is not responsible for the program content. The county shall be responsible
for developing, implementing, and enforcing policies for the use of its
government access channel.
   C.   In lieu of establishing its own government access channel, the county
reserves the right to develop government access programming in conjunction with
municipalities located in Kane County for cablecasting over municipal
government access channels. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
 
Notes
1 1. 220 ILCS 5/21-601.
10.5-182: PUBLIC ACCESS CHANNEL:
   A.   Upon request of the county, each grantee or holder shall provide
channel capacity for public access programming on the most basic cable or video
service tier offered by grantee or holder in accordance with section 611 of the
cable act (47 USC section 531), or on a mutually agreed upon tier of service.
The grantee or holder shall designate one channel on its CATV system or video
service system for the use of the county for the purpose of providing public
access programming. This channel shall be made available to unincorporated as
well as incorporated county residents.
   B.   A public access channel shall be made available to the residents of the
county or to not for profit organizations that serve the residents of the
county, on a first come, first served, nondiscriminatory basis, consistent with
the goal of maximum availability of access. Where a grantee or a holder
operates a studio for public access programming, a grantee or holder may not
charge for the use of the channel itself by an individual or organization,
however, a grantee or holder may, at its discretion, impose reasonable charges
for training, materials, or the production time of its professional staff.
   C.   The public access channel shall not be used for commercial purposes in
accordance with 47 USC section 611, nor shall the channel be used for the
promotion of political candidates, lottery information, and obscene, indecent,
or other programming that contains unprotected speech under federal law.
   D.   In the event that the operator of a public access studio is an entity
other than the county, the county shall have the right to review the operator's
access rules and requirements upon reasonable written notice to the operator.
Where the county determines that a change in the access rules is necessary, the
county shall notify the operator in writing and informally meet and confer with
the operator to implement the proposed rule change.
   E.   The county may provide for the creation of a public access corporation
as a condition of a franchise agreement, and for funding the same in the
franchise agreement. A holder shall be subject to providing equivalent funding
for the public access channel in accordance with the terms and conditions of a
video service provider fee ordinance that includes provisions for access
channel funding in accordance with 220 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/21-801(d).
(Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-183: EDUCATIONAL ACCESS CHANNEL:
   A.   Upon request of the county, a grantee or a holder shall provide channel
capacity for educational access programming on the most basic cable or video
service tier offered by grantee in accordance with section 611 of the cable act
(47 USC section 531), or on a mutually agreed upon tier of service. The grantee
or holder shall designate one channel on its CATV system or video service
system for the purpose of providing educational access programming.
This channel shall be made available to unincorporated as well as incorporated
county residents.
   B.   The educational access channel shall be made available for the use of
schools, including colleges or universities at no charge. A school, college, or
university operating the educational access channel shall adopt operating rules
for the educational access channel to be filed with the county prior to
activation of the channel.
   C.   The educational access channel shall not be used for commercial
purposes in accordance with 47 USC section 611, provided, however, that a
school may impose a charge for telecourses carried on the educational access
channel that are directly related to the educational mission of the school.
Such charges shall be used to cover the cost of providing the telecourse and
shall not be used for profitmaking purposes.
   D.   An educational access channel shall not be used for the promotion of
political candidates, lottery information, and obscene, indecent, or other
programming that contains unprotected speech under federal law. (Ord. 08-252,
8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-184: EMERGENCY ALERT SYSTEM:
A grantee shall comply with all applicable requirements of the federal
communications commission involving the distribution and notification of
federal, state, and local emergency messages over the emergency alert system
applicable to cable operators. The grantee will provide the county with
sufficient information regarding how to submit, via telephone or web listing, a
local emergency alert for distribution over its cable network. To the extent
that the county requires incumbent cable operators to provide emergency alert
system messages or services in excess of the requirements of this section, the
grantee shall comply with any such additional requirements within the
jurisdiction of the county.
The grantee may provide a local emergency alert to an area larger than the
boundaries of the unincorporated areas of the county. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008,
eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-185 - 10.5-189: RESERVED:
DIVISION 15. GOVERNMENTAL APPROVALS, LICENSES AND PERMITS
10.5-190: APPLICATION AND REGISTRATION REQUIRED:
A grantee shall apply for all necessary federal, state, and county governmental
permits, licenses, and other required authorizations with the establishment,
construction, operation, and maintenance of the CATV system and the system
facilities and shall register the franchise with the FCC within thirty (30)
days of the effective date of the franchise. No system shall be constructed,
nor any system construction commenced unless all such permits, licenses, and
authorizations have been obtained. A franchise agreement grant shall not
include a grant of any county permit, license or authorization, other than the
authority granted by the franchise itself. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-
2008)
10.5-191 - 10.5-199: RESERVED:
DIVISION 16. CONSTRUCTION TIMETABLE
10.5-200: EXTENSION OF SERVICES:
   A.   A grantee that is a cable operator shall be required to offer the
services of a CATV system to potential subscribers within the franchise area
within twenty four (24) months of the effective date of the franchise agreement
or as may be otherwise provided in the franchise agreement.
   B.   Failure to complete construction within the time frames set forth
herein shall constitute a breach of the terms of any franchise agreement.
However, in locations in which the density of residential dwelling units,
adverse terrain, or other factors render construction of the system and the
offering of services impracticable or technically unfeasible, or create an
undue economic burden, the Kane County development department may, upon the
written request of the grantee, either waive the construction of the system
into such areas, or allow the construction and offer of service on such special
terms, conditions, and provisions as are reasonable and fair to the county, the
grantee, and the potential subscribers in such areas.
   C.   Upon completion of the construction and provision of services required
within the time frames of completion set forth in this section or a franchise
agreement, a grantee shall file with the Kane County development department a
notice of completion as provided in subsection 10.5-201D of this chapter. (Ord.
08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-201: COMPLETION:
   A.   A final order of completion shall be issued by the Kane County
development department when:
      1.   Construction of the system has been completed within the franchise
area in compliance with construction standards and the design and other
requirements of this article.
      2.   Cable service has been made available to one hundred percent (100%)
of the dwelling units within the franchise area unless a waiver has been
approved or unless the grantee is a video service provider following the build-
out requirements of 220 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/21-1101.
      3.   Any and all channels, equipment, and other programming facilities,
services, resources or benefits, including financial support, for access
programming purposes have been completed and made available, except for those
items or funds that are to be provided at a later date.
      4.   Complete and accurate "as built" plans pursuant to the provisions of
division 11 of this article have been filed or made available by the grantee to
the county and applicable townships; and
      5.   A notice of completion has been filed by the grantee as provided
herein.
   B.   For purposes of this article, cable service shall be deemed to be made
available when it is offered on a nondiscriminatory basis for immediate usage
to the owner, or representative of the owner empowered to consent to use, of
the property of each home within the franchise area.
   C.   For the purpose of determining compliance with the provisions of this
article and of determining completion under this section, the total number of
dwelling units within each franchise area shall be deemed to be the actual
number of units available for occupancy as of a date forty five (45) calendar
days in advance of the date of filing by the grantee of the notice of
completion; provided that the grantee files the notice of completion with a
good faith belief that it has in fact achieved completion as of the date of
filing.
   D.   A grantee who asserts completion shall file a written notification with
the Kane County development department. The notice of completion shall state
the total number of homes available for occupancy within the franchise area
forty five (45) calendar days in advance of the filing of the notice, the total
number of dwelling units to which cable service has been made available in the
franchise area of the date of filing and shall otherwise certify completion as
defined by subsection A of this section. Neither the notice of completion nor
the statements, assertions, or certifications contained therein shall be deemed
to be binding upon the county.
   E.   During the period of the construction of the system within the sixty
(60) day period following filing of the notice of completion, all elements and
components thereof, and all equipment and studio facilities required by the
franchise agreement shall be subject to inspection by county employees or
authorized agents or representatives thereof, for the purpose of determining
whether the system and related facilities comply with the franchise agreement
and the provisions of this article. The grantee shall authorize such inspection
and provide such information and cooperation as is required in order to permit
an adequate investigation to determine the existence or nonexistence of such
compliance.
   F.   The grantee shall offer to install, make operational, and render cable
services to all homes within the franchise area in accordance with this article
and the franchise agreement, within the time period specified in the franchise
agreement. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-202 - 10.5-209: RESERVED:
DIVISION 17. ASSIGNMENT OR TRANSFER
10.5-210: COUNTY BOARD APPROVAL REQUIRED:
   A.   Except as otherwise provided in a franchise agreement, the CATV system
shall not be sold, assigned, leased, sublet, sold or leased back, hypothecated
or mortgaged, either in whole or in part, disposed of, transferred in trust,
pledged in whole or in part, by voluntary sale, merger, sale and leaseback
consolidation or otherwise, or by forced or involuntary sale, nor shall title
thereto, either legal or equitable, or any right or interest therein, pass to
or vest in any party without the prior written consent of the county expressed
by ordinance and then on such conditions as therein may be prescribed. Any
sale, transfer, or assignment not made according to the procedures set forth in
this chapter shall render the franchise agreement void.
The sale, transfer, or assignment in bulk of the major part of the tangible
assets of a grantee shall be considered an assignment and shall be subject to
the provisions of this section.
   B.   In the absence of extraordinary circumstances, the county will not
approve any such transfer of control or ownership prior to substantial
completion of construction or reconstruction of the CATV system.
Notwithstanding the foregoing a grantee may transfer ownership or control of
the franchise or the CATV system, after notice to the county, to an entity
controlling, controlled by, or under common control with grantee, where such
transfer does not result in a change in the management, operation or ultimate
controlling entity of the franchise or the system without any release of the
liability of the grantee. The recipient of a transferred franchise for said
system shall not be subject to the requirements for new franchises, nor shall
the recipient be considered a new franchise for any other purpose provided by
law, provided that the transferee agrees in writing to abide by all of the
terms and conditions of the franchise agreement with the transferor. In no
event shall a transfer of ownership or control be approved without the
successor(s) in interest to the franchise agreement agreeing in writing to
comply with the terms, obligations, and conditions of the franchise agreement
for the remainder of the franchise term. The grantee as transferor, shall
promptly cure any present or ongoing franchise violations or defaults prior to
the county's granting of consent for the transfer of control or ownership of
the franchise.
   C.   Whenever any transfer subject to county approval under subsection A of
this section is proposed, a grantee and any proposed assignee or transferee of
the franchise shall submit an FCC form 394, or its successor at least one
hundred twenty (120) days prior to the proposed date of transfer containing or
accompanied by such information as is required in accordance with applicable
law and FCC regulations. In addition, the grantee and/or the transferee shall
provide any and all information and documentation of the legal, financial,
managerial, technical, and character qualifications of the prospective
transferee or controlling party to operate and maintain the cable system. The
grantee and the prospective transferee or controlling party shall provide all
other reasonable information as allowed under applicable law requested by the
county in connection with such inquiry within the time frames established by
the FCC, and that addresses the effect of the proposed transfer or assignment
upon the public.
   D.   Prior approval of the county shall be required where ownership or
control of more than twenty five percent (25%), or such other percentage as may
be agreed to in a franchise agreement, of the right of control of a grantee
acquired, is transferred or during the term of the franchise in any transaction
or series of transactions by a person or group of persons acting individually
or collectively, on the effective date of the franchise agreement. The word
"control" as used herein is not limited to major stockholders but also includes
actual working control in whatever manner exercised. By its acceptance of the
franchise agreement, a grantee specifically acknowledges and agrees that any
such acquisition occurring without a prior approval of the county shall render
the franchise void.
   E.   Subject to any limitations set forth in the franchise agreement, any
transfer of the grantee's cable system, or any part thereof, subject to the
county's right of approval pursuant to subsection A of this section shall also
be subject to the county's right to elect to acquire the grantee's cable
system, or the part thereof proposed to be transferred, for the consideration
specified in a bona fide purchase offer based upon valuations from a qualified
firm specializing in cable system appraisals acceptable to the grantee. The
county shall exercise this right by written notice to a grantee within thirty
(30) days following its receipt of the notice required in subsection B of this
section. Except for the consideration, the county shall be obligated in
exercising this right to accept all other terms of the proposed transfer. The
county's rights hereunder shall in no way affect its independent rights under
any other provision of this chapter or under the franchise agreement.
   F.   The county shall be deemed to have consented to a proposed transfer if
the county fails to render a final decision on the request for approval of the
proposed transfer within one hundred twenty (120) days following the county's
receipt of the completed written application containing such information as
required in subsection C of this section, unless the county and the applicant
agree in writing to extend the time for the county to review the application
and to grant or deny its consent. The consent of the county for the extension
of time shall not be unreasonably withheld.
   G.   Any transfer approved by the county shall be made by a document
evidencing closing of the transaction, an executed copy of which shall be filed
with the city within sixty (60) days after any such transfer.
   H.   Any sale, transfer, assignment, mortgage, pledge, lease, sublease or
other encumbrance of whatever kind or nature made in violation of the
provisions of this section shall be void.
   I.   The transferee shall reimburse county for any incidental administrative
expenses, including reasonable attorney fees, and fees for advisory or other
assistance provided on behalf of county that has been expended under this
section.
   J.   The consent or approval of the county to any transfer of the grantee,
franchise, or other control thereof, shall not constitute a waiver or release
of the rights of the county in and to the use of public streets and public
rights of way, and any transfer shall, by its terms, be expressly subordinate
to the terms and conditions of the franchise being transferred. (Ord. 08-252,
8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-211: RENEGOTIATION:
The county shall have the option of renegotiating any term of a franchise
agreement prior to the county's consent to any assignment, sale, transfer, or
other change of ownership to the franchise. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-
2008)
10.5-212: FORECLOSURE, RECEIVERSHIP:
   A.   Foreclosure: Upon the foreclosure or other judicial sale of all or a
substantial part of the system, or upon the termination of any lease covering
all or a substantial part of the system, the grantee shall notify the county of
such fact. Such notification shall be treated as a notification that a change
in control of the grantee has taken place, and the provisions of this division,
governing the consent of the board to such change in control of the grantee
shall apply.
   B.   Nonbankruptcy Foreclosure: In the event of a nonbankruptcy foreclosure,
or, in the event of a foreclosure involving bankruptcy where the county's right
to cancel a franchise is allowed by the U.S. bankruptcy court, or a court of
competent jurisdiction, the county shall have the right to cancel a franchise
one hundred twenty (120) days after the appointment of a receiver, or trustee,
to take over and conduct the business of the grantee, whether in receivership,
reorganization, bankruptcy or other action or proceeding, unless such
receivership or trusteeship shall have been vacated prior to the expiration of
one hundred twenty (120) days, or unless:
      1.   Within one hundred twenty (120) days after his/her election or
appointment, such receiver or trustee shall have fully complied with all the
provisions of this chapter and remedied all defaults thereunder; and
      2.   Such receiver or trustee, within the one hundred twenty (120) days,
shall have executed an agreement, duly approved by the court having
jurisdiction in the premises, whereby such receiver or trustee assumes and
agrees to be bound by each and every provision of this chapter and the
franchise granted to the grantee. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-213 - 10.5-219: RESERVED:
DIVISION 18. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
10.5-220: POLICY ESTABLISHED:
A grantee hereby agrees that it will not refuse to hire or employ, nor will it
bar or discharge from employment, nor discriminate against any person in
compensation or in terms, conditions, or privileges of employment because of
age, race, creed, color, national origin, gender, or disability, and will
comply with the FCC requirements relating to employment. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-
2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-221 - 10.5-229: RESERVED:
DIVISION 19. INDEMNIFICATION AND INSURANCE
10.5-230: INDEMNIFICATION BY GRANTEE:
A grantee shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the county and its
commissioners, officials, employees and agents from and against any liability
or claims that arise out of the grantee's installation, construction,
operation, or maintenance of the CATV system under a franchise agreement;
breach of a franchise agreement, or violation of this chapter by the grantee;
copyright, trademark, service mark, or patent infringements, or of any other
right of any person, or a failure by the grantee to secure consents from the
owners, authorized distributors, or franchisees of programs to be delivered by
the CATV system (but not including claims arising from any county produced
programming); the conduct of the grantee's business in the county; or in any
way arising out of the grantee's enjoyment or exercise of the franchise,
regardless of whether the act or omission complained of is authorized, allowed,
or prohibited by applicable local, state, or federal law or a franchise
agreement. This also includes, but is not limited to, any claim against the
grantee for invasion of the right of privacy, defamation of any person or as a
result of the county's making, or declining to make any information or
documents provided to the county pursuant to this chapter or a franchise
agreement available pursuant to the Illinois freedom of information act 1 .
The county shall give the grantee prompt and timely written notice no later
than thirty (30) days after receipt of any claim or the commencement of any
action, suit, or other proceeding covered by the provisions of this section. If
the county reasonably believes separate counsel to be necessary due to a
conflict of interest between the county and the grantee, the grantee shall have
the right to approve such counsel, which approval shall not be unreasonably
withheld, and shall pay all reasonable costs for such counsel.
Nothing herein shall be deemed to prevent the county from cooperating with the
grantee and participating in the defense of any litigation by its own counsel
at its own cost and expense, provided, however, that after consultation with
the county and subject to the county's consent, grantee shall have the right to
defend, settle, or compromise any claim or action arising hereunder.
Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to waive the tort immunity of the
county. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
 
Notes
1 1. 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.
10.5-231: GRANTEE INSURANCE:
   A.   As part of the indemnification provided by the provisions of this
article, but without limiting the foregoing, upon award of a franchise and
prior to commencement of the system, each grantee shall file with the Kane
County development department, and at all times thereafter maintain in full
force and effect at its sole expense, evidence of an acceptable policy or
policies of liability insurance, including comprehensive general liability
insurance, products/completed operations liability, personal injury liability,
owners and contractors protective liability, broad form property damage,
contractual liability, automobile liability, including owned, nonowned, and
hired automobiles, workers' compensation, and employer liability. The policy or
policies shall specifically recognize and cover the indemnification provisions
of this article and shall name as primary insured the county, and in their
capacity as such, its officers, agents, and employees. The grantee and the
county and officers, agents and employees shall be named as coinsureds, and the
policy or policies shall contain cross liability endorsements. Policies of
insurance shall be in the minimum single limit amount of five million dollars
($5,000,000.00) per occurrence. Said insurance shall provide that the insurance
provided by the grantee shall be primary and that any provision of any contract
of insurance or other risk protection benefit or self-insurance policy
purchased or in effect or enacted by the county and any other insurance shall
be in excess thereof.
   B.   The insurer or insurers shall be authorized to write the required
insurance and shall be approved therefor by the state of Illinois. All
insurance carriers and surplus line carriers shall be rated "A-" or better and
of a class size of "X" or higher by A.M. Best Company. The form and substance
of the policy or policies of insurance shall be subject to approval by the
county.
   C.   The policy or policies of insurance shall be maintained by the grantee
in full force and effect during the entire term of a franchise agreement. Each
policy of insurance shall contain a statement on its face that the insurer will
not cancel the policy or fail to renew the policy, whether for nonpayment of
premium, or otherwise, and whether at the request of the grantee or for other
reasons, except after thirty (30) days' advance written notice by insurer sent
by registered mail, return receipt requested, to the Kane County development
department.
   D.   A grantee shall file with the Kane County development department
certified copies of all insurance policies required upon the written request of
the county.
   E.   In the event of the cancellation of any insurance policy required
herein or upon grantee's failure to procure said insurance, the county shall
have the right to terminate a franchise agreement, or alternatively, to procure
such insurance and charge the cost thereof to the grantee. Such costs may be
paid from the security bond or construction bond as set forth in section 10.5-
170 of this chapter, or by any other means deemed appropriate by the county.
(Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-232 - 10.5-239: RESERVED:
DIVISION 20. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS
10.5-240: FAIRNESS OF ACCESSIBILITY:
The entire network of a grantee shall be operated in a manner consistent with
the principles of fairness and equal accessibility of its facilities,
equipment, channels, studios, and other services to all citizens, businesses,
public agencies, or other entities having a legitimate use for the network. No
one shall be arbitrarily excluded from its use. Allocation of the use of said
facilities shall be made according to the rules, policies, or decisions of the
grantee and any regulatory agencies affecting the same. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-
2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-241: SUBSCRIBERS' WIRING AND ANTENNA:
A grantee is expressly prohibited from deliberately removing, requiring the
removal of or from offering to remove or to provide any inducements for removal
of any wiring or antenna equipment belonging to the subscriber as a condition
for provision of service by a grantee. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-242: COPYRIGHT LAWS:
A grantee shall comply with all copyright laws, rules, and regulations,
including, but not limited to, FCC requirements. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff.
9-1-2008)
10.5-243: PUBLICATION COSTS:
In the event that publication of a franchise agreement is required by law, a
grantee shall assume any cost of publication and such is payable upon the
request of the county. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-244: WAIVER OF PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE:
The county shall have the right to waive or modify any provision of this
article. However, any waiver shall be restricted to the particular subject
matter of the waiver, and in no way shall be considered precedent for any other
waiver, nor shall the county be obligated to consider any request for a similar
waiver. Further, the county reserves the right to deny any waiver. (Ord. 08-
252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-245: NO WAIVER OF RIGHTS:
The failure of the county or grantee on one or more occasions to exercise a
right or to require compliance or performance under this chapter or any other
applicable law shall not be deemed to constitute a waiver of such right or a
waiver of compliance or performance, unless such right, compliance or
performance has specifically been waived in writing. No delay or omission of
the county or grantee to exercise any right or remedy shall be considered to be
a waiver of or acquiescence in any default. Nothing in this chapter shall be
construed as a waiver of any rights, substantive or procedural, grantee or
county may have under federal or state law unless such waiver is expressly
stated herein. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-246: GENERAL FILING AND NOTICE PROVISIONS:
   A.   Except as otherwise provided in this article, all documents and notices
or other franchise related material required by this article shall be filed
with the Kane County development department at the Kane County Governmental
Center, Building A, 4th Floor, 719 Batavia Avenue, Geneva, IL 60134. All
notices and franchise fee or video service provider fee payments shall be sent
by certified mail. Other documents may be sent by overnight mail services, such
as Federal Express, with a confirmation signature, or by facsimile transfer
("fax") and electronic mail ("e-mail").
   B.   Except as provided elsewhere in this article, the county shall not take
any final action involving the modification, renewal, revocation, or
termination of a grantee's franchise unless the county has: 1) advised a
grantee in writing at least thirty (30) days prior to a meeting where such
action is contemplated as to its time, place, and purpose; and 2) published a
notice, at least once, fourteen (14) days before the meeting in a newspaper of
general circulation within the county; provided such notice need not be given
of any adjourned or continued meeting where notice was given of the original
meeting. The grantee and interested persons shall be entitled to be heard at
such meeting. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-247: NEW TECHNOLOGIES:
   A.   If, as a result of technological developments during the term of a
franchise agreement, the quality or quantity of programming or services
available to subscribers of the grantee's CATV system in municipalities
immediately adjacent to unincorporated areas of Kane County become subject to
upgrade or are benefiting from new services or technologies not available in
the immediately adjacent unincorporated area or areas of the county, a grantee
shall, at the request of the cable administrator, investigate the feasibility
of implementing such new developments.
The grantee shall implement such technological developments if such
implementation: 1) can be accomplished without adding an unwarranted financial
burden to subscribers and 2) is economically and technically feasible and
viable for the grantee.
   B.   In determining whether or not a grantee shall be required to implement
such new developments, the cable administrator and a grantee shall consider,
among other factors, and consistent with federal law, the remaining term of its
agreement, performance demonstrating the operational feasibility of the new
developments, construction costs, the adaptability of such developments to the
grantee's system or any part thereof and the potential marketability of the new
services and other factors affecting the economic feasibility and viability of
implementation of such new technologies. In the event that an investigation of
the foregoing determines, through a written report by the grantee to the cable
administrator, that implementing said new services or technologies does not add
an unwarranted financial burden to subscribers and is economically and
technically feasible and viable for the grantee, said new services or
technologies shall be implemented no later than ninety (90) days from the date
of the receipt of the report by the cable administrator. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-
2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-248: SEVERABILITY:
If any section, subsection, clause, phrase, or portion of this chapter is for
any reason held invalid or unconstitutional by any federal or state court or
administrative or governmental agency of competent jurisdiction, including, but
not limited to, the FCC, such portion shall be deemed a separate, distinct, and
independent provision, and such holding shall not affect the validity of the
remaining portions of this chapter, which shall be applied and construed as
reasonably as possible in the absence of the invalidated provision. (Ord. 08-
252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-249: SEXUAL HARASSMENT POLICY:
Any grantee holding a franchise on the effective date hereof, or which is
awarded a franchise under the conditions of this chapter, shall be required to
have in force a written policy regarding sexual harassment which complies in
all respects with the Illinois human rights act, 775 Illinois Compiled Statutes
5/2-105(A)(4) (1997). (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-250: COMPLIANCE WITH OSHA REGULATIONS:
A grantee shall comply with the standards of the occupational safety and health
administration (OSHA), and safety standards established by the department of
labor of the state of Illinois in maintaining its operational facilities,
working conditions, and work procedures utilized as a part of the construction,
upgrade, installation, repair and maintenance of the CATV system. Grantee's
equipment shall bear all FCC and appropriate safety agency markings. (Ord. 08-
252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-251: COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS:
The county and the grantee shall at all times comply with all applicable laws
and regulations of federal, state and local governments, or any administrative
agencies thereof, as such applicable laws and regulations may be amended now or
hereafter. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-252: GRANTEE MAY PROMULGATE RULES:
A grantee shall have the authority to promulgate such rules, regulations,
terms, and conditions of its business as shall be reasonably necessary to
enable it to exercise its rights and perform its services under this chapter
and the rules of the FCC, and to assure uninterrupted service to each and all
of its subscribers. Such rules and regulations shall not be deemed to have the
force of law. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-253: LANDLORD AND TENANT:
   A.   No owner, or owner's agent or representative, of any multiple- unit
residential dwelling shall interfere with the right of any tenant or lawful
resident thereof to receive cable service or video service, installation or
maintenance from a grantee regulated by and lawfully operating under a valid
and existing franchise issued by the county or a holder regulated by and
lawfully operating under a valid and existing authorization to provide video
service issued by the ICC.
   B.   No owner, or owner's agent or representative of any multiple- unit
residential dwelling shall penalize, charge or surcharge a tenant or resident
or forfeit or threaten to forfeit any right of such tenant or resident, or
discriminate in any way against such tenant or resident who requests or
receives cable service or video service from a grantee operating under a valid
and existing franchise issued by the county or a holder regulated by and
lawfully operating under a valid and existing authorization to provide video
service issued by the ICC.
   C.   Nothing in this chapter shall prohibit a person from requiring that
system facilities conform to laws and regulations and reasonable conditions
necessary to protect safety, functioning, appearance and value of premises or
the convenience and safety of persons or property.
   D.   Nothing in this chapter shall prohibit a person from requiring a
grantee or a holder to agree to indemnify the owner, or his agents or
representatives for damages or from liability for damages caused by the
installation, operation, maintenance or removal of cable system or video system
facilities. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-254: PROHIBITED ACTS:
   A.   It shall be unlawful for any person to install, attach, wire, program,
or connect, or cause to be installed, attached, wired, programmed, or connected
any equipment, device, or computer hardware or software, which enables the use
of cable television or data signals transmitted by a grantee without
compensation to said grantee for said cable service signals. This section shall
not prohibit the recording of programming or downloading of data as allowed
under applicable state and federal laws.
   B.   No person receiving within the franchise area any cable service,
program, or signal transmitted by any grantee operating under a franchise
issued by the franchising authority shall resell such service, program, or
signal without the expressed, written consent of the grantee.
   C.   Violations of the provisions of this section shall be punishable by a
fine of no less than five hundred dollars ($500.00) per day per occurrence, and
where applicable, incarceration as so prescribed by statutory provisions
concerning theft of services. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-255: NO RECOURSE AGAINST COUNTY:
To the extent that the local government tort immunity act and any other laws
immunize the county and its officials, boards, commissions, agents, or
employees, a grantee shall have no recourse whatsoever against the county or
its officials, boards, commissions, agents, or employees for any loss, costs,
expense, or damages arising out of any provision or requirement of this chapter
or franchise agreement. A grantee shall expressly acknowledge that upon
accepting the right, privilege and franchise granted pursuant to this chapter,
it does so relying upon its own investigation and understanding of the power
and authority of the county. By the acceptance of a franchise, a grantee shall
agree it will not at any time set up against the county in any claim or
proceeding any provision, condition or term of this chapter or the franchise
agreement as unreasonable, arbitrary or void or that the county had no power or
authority to make such provision, term or condition as part of or pursuant to
this chapter, except as to those matters preempted by federal or state law.
(Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-256: TIME IS OF THE ESSENCE:
Whenever any provision of this chapter, or a franchise agreement, shall set
forth any time for any act to be performed by a grantee, such time shall be
deemed to be of the essence. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-257: FORCE MAJEURE:
Whenever a period of time is provided for in this chapter, or a franchise
agreement, for either the county or a grantee to do or perform any act or
obligation, neither party shall be liable for any delays due to war, riot,
insurrection, rebellion, unavoidable casualty or damage to personnel,
materials, or equipment, fire, flood, storm, earthquake, tornado, orders of a
court of competent jurisdiction, any act of nature, failure of a utility
provider to provide pole attachments on reasonable terms or conditions
therefor, or any cause beyond the control of said party. In such event, said
time period shall be extended for the amount of time said party is so delayed.
An act or omission shall not be deemed to be beyond a grantee's control if
committed, omitted, or caused by a corporation or other business entity which
holds a controlling interest in the grantee, whether directly or indirectly.
Further, the failure of a grantee to obtain financing, or to pay any money due
from it to any person, including the county, for whatever reason, shall not be
an act or omission which is beyond the control of the grantee. (Ord. 08-252, 8-
12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-258: NO WAIVER OF RIGHTS BESTOWED BY VIRTUE OF LAW:
The county does not waive or release rights bestowed upon it by virtue of law
or statute. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
10.5-259: CONFLICTING ORDINANCES REPEALED:
All ordinances or parts of ordinances thereof in conflict herewith, are hereby
repealed to the extent of any such conflict. (Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-
2008)
10.5-260: GOVERNING LAW AND VENUE:
This chapter shall be governed in accordance insofar as applicable with the
laws of the state of Illinois. Where federal jurisdiction applies, this chapter
shall be governed by the applicable laws and agencies of the United States
government. Venue shall be in either the circuit court of Kane County, or the
United States district court, northern district of Illinois, eastern division.
(Ord. 08-252, 8-12-2008, eff. 9-1-2008)
CHAPTER 11
ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT
ARTICLE I. SOLID WASTE
SECTION:
Division 1. Generally
11-1: Scope
11-2: Enforcement
11-3: Garbage And Refuse
11-3-1: Deposit Of Trash, Garbage, Etc., On Highway Right Of Way Unlawful;
Penalty
11-3-2: Misuse Of Public Trash Receptacles
11-4: Vehicles
11-5: Inspection
11-5-1: Violation
11-5-2: Fines
11-6 - 11-20: Reserved
Division 2. Solid Waste Disposal Fee
11-21: Purposes
11-22: Solid Waste Disposal Fee
11-23: Exemptions From Fee
11-24: Solid Waste Disposal Report
11-25: Termination
11-26: Appeals
11-27: Effective Date
11-28 - 11-40: Reserved
DIVISION 1. GENERALLY
11-1: SCOPE:
This article regulates the storage, transportation and disposal of solid waste
within the limits of Kane County, Illinois. (Ord. 08-168, 5-13-2008)
11-2: ENFORCEMENT:
The county shall have jurisdiction for the purpose of enforcement of this
article as referenced in 70 Illinois Compiled Statutes 905/20. (Ord. 08-168, 5-
13-2008)
11-3: GARBAGE AND REFUSE:
   A.   Generally: All disposal of garbage and refuse within the county shall
conform to the provisions of the "state of Illinois environmental protection
act, title V: land pollution and refuse disposal", copies of which shall be on
file in the environmental management office. Except in accordance with those
provisions, it shall be unlawful to dump or deposit or permit to remain upon
the ground within the limits of this county, any garbage, cans, rubbish,
refuse, or other substances which by reason of its quantity or decomposition
would become foul, odorous, subject to spontaneous combustion, or tend to breed
rodents, flies, mosquitoes, or harmful bacteria, and become detrimental to
public health or conducive to the spread of disease.
   B.   Placing Or Leaving, Burning: No person shall place, leave, dump or
accumulate any garbage, rubbish or other refuse in any building, or on any
premises, improved or vacant, or upon any open lot, alley or road in the
county. No person shall burn garbage out of doors in the county.
   C.   Accumulation And Storage: No person shall accumulate or store on any
premises, improved or vacant, or in any open lot or roadway in the county any
of the following materials:
      1.   Salvage Materials: Any refuse or waste, discharge or salvage
materials, including junk autos, except in a junkyard;
      2.   Unusual Materials: Any materials other than those ordinarily
associated with the use for which the premises are regularly intended. (Ord.
08-168, 5-13-2008)
11-3-1: DEPOSIT OF TRASH, GARBAGE, ETC., ON HIGHWAY RIGHT OF WAY UNLAWFUL;
PENALTY:
